### Information Barriers in Purview #### Overview - **Purpose**: Information Barriers enforce communication restrictions between specific users or groups. - **Compliance**: Critical for ensuring regulatory adherence in industries like finance or healthcare. #### Key Features - **Policy Creation**: Define and implement interaction policies. - **Segmentation**: Separate confidential teams to prevent unauthorized communications. - **Monitoring**: Continuous surveillance of communication activities. - **Audit Trails**: Comprehensive logging to track policy enforcement. - **Automated Controls**: Utilize AI to detect and block restricted communications. #### Benefits - **Risk Mitigation**: Helps in reducing insider threats. - **Compliance Assurance**: Ensures adherence to industry regulations. - **Security**: Enhances data protection by controlling access. ### Implementation Steps 1. **Define Policies**: Outline clear communication rules based on business needs. 2. **Assign User Groups**: Segment users into appropriate categories. 3. **Configure Restrictions**: Set up communication barriers using Purview. 4. **Monitor and Adjust**: Regularly review and refine policies and practices. 5. **Audit Compliance**: Use Purview tools to maintain a compliance log and ensure adherence. For more detailed information on setting up Information Barriers in Purview, visit: [Microsoft Purview Documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview)
